page.title: 18Children in Melchbourne
page.content: Of the few children in Melchbourne only nine are under twelve years of age. Activities tend to be self-invented with bycycle riding along the concrete tracks in the woods being a favourite. The schools are all a car or coach ride away, depending upon the school chosen by the parents. To go swimming, to Brownies, Cubs or horse riding means a car ride of at least 3 miles - nothing is on the doorstep. However, an important event in the weekly calendar for the children, causes the normal routine to be forgotten. Children scatter in all directions looking for their pennies at the sound of the 'sweetie' van arriving. This is a service run by an elderly couple, visiting the village selling not only groceries but penny-style sweets for children.
